brewery.name: Zebulon Artisan Ales
brewery.description:
We are a small production brewery with a sweet little tasting area that is open on Fridays and Saturdays from 1-6 pm. We are closed on other days in order to brew or bottle. We are located in downtown Weaverville which is just 10 minutes from downtown Asheville.

We offer small pours and flights of both the beers that we have bottled as well as experimental small batches available only at the brewery. Chilled bottles are available for enjoying on or off premise as well.

The name Zebulon was chosen because it just sounds awesome, and it starts with a Z which is always cool. There is the famous explorer Zebulon Pike, there is the USS Zebulon from Star Trek, and of course the locally born NC governor Zebulon Vance. We just think it sounds bad ass.

brewery.name: Brown Truck Brewery
brewery.description: Brown Truck Brewery is committed to providing craft beer, mainly sourced from local and seasonal ingredients, in a unique and inviting environment.

brewery.name: Cavendish Brewing Company
brewery.description: Welcome to Cavendish Brewing Company. We are a local Charlotte metro area brewery that specializes in Old World beers. Located in Gastonia, North Carolina

brewery.name: Durty Bull Brewing Company
brewery.description: Old world brewing techniques blended with creativity and passion, Durty Bull Brewing Company will be a 15-barrel craft brewery and tasting room specializing in barrel aged and sour beers as well as other unconventional offerings brewed for the residents of The Bull City and beyond.

brewery.name: Four Wagons Brewing Company
brewery.description: Four Wagons Brewing Co is located in downtown Wendell. Wendell founder, R. B. Whitley lined up four tobacco wagons when creating the streets in Wendell.

brewery.name: Brewery 99
brewery.description:
very small scale brewery, producing ancient, traditional, modern, and spontaneous
fermented beverages, while in the midst of bohemian artist free spirits making art.

brewery.name: Three Spirits Brewery
brewery.description: Three Spirits is a microbrewery soon to be located in Southwest Charlotte. We will produce high quality, unfiltered craft beers served in a soothing environment. This will be a place like no other microbrewery you have been to in the past. Initially we will start with 4 different beers. A red lager, "Red Moon Rising", an IPA, "Hopper's Delight", a brown ale, "Agate Have It!", and a light golden ale called "Southern Bliss". There are 5 other recipes which will be released throughout the year. Pending finding the right spot, we hope to be open by the Fall.

brewery.name: Ghostface Brewing
brewery.description:
Not a Full Scale Revolution, Just a Little Evolution!

Ghostface Brewing offers handcrafted beers, ciders, mead and wine.

brewery.name: Joymongers Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Joymongers Brewing Co: "Spreading joy, one pint at a time." We focus on providing you with a huge variety of the freshest brews in our taproom and patios!

brewery.name: Fainting Goat Brewing Company
brewery.description: The mission of the Fainting Goat Brewing Company is to consistently provide our customers with a variety of high quality, full flavored, drinkable, hand-crafted beers in a casual setting. We are driven to share our passion for brewing and to promote the craft beer industry with enthusiasts and novices alike.

data.name: Main Brewery
data.hoursOfOperation:
We’re open Wednesday – Sunday
Wednesday – Friday 4pm-close
Saturday & Sunday 2pm-close

brewery.name: Southern Appalachian Brewery
brewery.description: We are a local micro brewery based in Hendersonville, North Carolina (about 20 miles south of Asheville). We look forward to seeing you in the tasting room!

brewery.name: Camelback Brewing Company
brewery.description: We are a craft beer brewing company locating in Sanford, NC. Stay tuned for updates!

brewery.name: Mountain Layers Brewing Company
brewery.description: Brewing craft beer in the Great Smoky Mountains in the beautiful town of Bryson City, North Carolina. Enjoy our two indoor taprooms and rooftop sundeck.

brewery.name: Howard Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Howard Brewing Company is a brand new craft brewery opening in Lenoir, North Carolina at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

We will be opening in a great old building downtown on West Avenue alongside the Carolina Distillery and a new pub-style restaurant. We are working on some great ideas at the building including rain water recapture, solar power, and renovating the building so the dining experience literally overlooks the brewery and distillery operations. We are excited to bring our beer to you as soon as we can and are acquiring our brewhouse and swinging the hammers as you read this...

brewery.name: Little City Brewing And Provisions Co.
brewery.nameShortDisplay: Little City Brewing And Provisions Co.
brewery.description: Boutique Fresh Foods Market and Brewery located in Raleigh's Glenwood South neighborhood.

brewery.name: Triangle Brewing Company
brewery.description:
We are a locally owned craft brewery situated in downtown Durham, North Carolina. Triangle Brewing Company is dedicated to producing well balanced, full-flavored, yet highly drinkable Belgian and American style ales.

Triangle beers are made with the finest hops and barley malt. Flavors harmonize, not fight for individual attention. Triangle beers are not pasteurized nor do we add preservatives (except for a healthy addition of hops). Seeing beer as equal to, if not superior to, wine, Triangle beers are designed to complement food. Because of this effort, soon one will be able to walk into any fine restaurant and pub in the Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill region and be pretty sure of finding a Triangle beer available.

brewery.name: Edenton Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Previously Chesapeake Bay Brewing.

Opened in 2003 by Brian Baker, who relocated to Raleigh from Edenton, NC rather than suffer the massive expense of moving ChesBay's brewing equipment to his building in Edenton, especially considering the local Raleigh customer base that was already in place after the demise of ChesBay.

In 2007, Baker sold the business to Geoff Lamb, who ultimately renamed the brewery after Edenton's most-popular label.

brewery.name: 4Chambers Brewing
brewery.description: 4Chambers Brewing is the microbrewery brainchild of Vincent Esposito. Right now, it's in the infancy stage as groundwork and start-up are still happening.

brewery.name: Chesapeake Bay Brewing Company
brewery.description: Formerly Rock Creek Brewing. Opened in 2001 by Scott Whitham and Brooke Baldridge, this brewery also carried some of the Rock Creek beers. The brewery and taproom closed in 2003.

brewery.name: Jordan Lake Brewing Company
brewery.description: Jordan Lake Brewing Company is coming to Cary! We are excited to bring great beers and an awesome tap room to enjoy them to the area!

brewery.name: Rock Creek Brewing Company
brewery.description: Formerly Pale Ale Brewing - segued into Chesapeake Bay Brewing in 2001.

brewery.name: Habitat Tavern and Commons
brewery.description: We are a brewery in north Asheville where friends and strangers can gather for excellent classic craft ales and have a space to form community.

brewery.name: Biltmore Brewing Company
brewery.description:
When something is truly exceptional it earns your loyalty. That’s why we named our beer after George Vanderbilt’s beloved St. Bernard, Cedric. Family photographs capture moments of Cedric enjoying sunshine on the Loggia and sneaking in quiet naps in the library. Wherever George was, Cedric was sure to follow. That’s the kind of loyalty that inspires us to craft a quality beer—a beer worth your loyalty.

In fact, we’d been thinking of creating a line of Biltmore beers bearing Cedric’s name for many years. Then, when the decision was made to open a tavern on the estate, aptly named Cedric’s Tavern, as part of the new Antler Hill Village, the opportunity presented itself to turn the idea of producing a line of beer into reality. That’s how Biltmore Brewing Company was established.

Each beer in Cedric’s line is crafted to the exacting standards that George Vanderbilt appreciated and is made in the traditional English style. Craft beer enthusiast and newly appointed manager of Cedric’s Tavern, Bryan McIntosh has led the style selection of these new brews.

brewery.name: Pale Ale Brewing Company
brewery.description: Formerly Tom Cat Brewing - segued into Rock Creek Brewing in 1999.

brewery.name: Bold Missy Brewery
brewery.description: Bold Missy Brewery is born from guts, glory and boldness. We are a brewery and tap room with good eats; a home for Bold Missys (or Misters) everywhere.

brewery.name: TomCat Brewing Company
brewery.description: Closed in 1996. Became Pale Ale Brewing.

brewery.name: Satulah Mountain Brewing Company
brewery.description: First brewery in Macon County.

brewery.name: Bessemer City Brewing
brewery.description: Bessemer City Brewing is located just 25 miles west of Charlotte on I85 near the base of Crowders Mountain in historic Bessemer City. The beer is currently brewed and served in the Whisky Mill Bar & Grill known locally for its excellent eats, rubs & sauces. BCB’s focus is to brew high quality craft beer in the style of beers from the United Kingdom & Ireland. We celebrate the pride of our city’s culture and history by naming our beers after original city founders, industries & landmarks.

brewery.name: G2B Restaurant & Brewery
brewery.description: Nano-Brewery in Durham, NC specializing in small batches that focus on pairing beer and food

brewery.name: Sycamore Brewing
brewery.description:
We have proud roots in home brewing and North Carolina, and we have been humbly perfecting some of our favorite recipes over the last 10 years.  We are incredibly excited to share them in the months to come.  Justin was born and raised here in Charlotte, and we couldn’t be happier for our brewery to become part of the city's dynamic and growing craft beer scene.  

If you love good beer as much as we do, we can't wait to have you join us in the taproom for a pint or two.  It's not long until we're pouring.

brewery.name: Gimghoul Brewing & Bottle Co.
brewery.description: Microbrewery on premise sales and beer to go. Great selection of bottles and cans from across the US and featuring NC.

brewery.name: Bill's Front Porch
brewery.description: Bill's Front Porch is the newest local pub and brewery in the Wilmington area. Stocked with local craft beer and tasty food, it's sure to be a favorite!

brewery.name: 217 Brew Works
brewery.description:
217 Brew Works is a 10 bbl Micro Craft Brewery located in Historic Downtown Wilson NC.  
We have a Tap Room that is both Dog and Kid Friendly.  We have 8 Core Brews and 4 Seasons Offerings on Tap.  
We host Live Music and Food Truck Events on Alternate Friday and Saturdays.  
We are located 20 yards from the Vollis Simpson Whirligig Park. 
Inside and Outside seating and a fully fenced 'Beer Garden / Dog Park".

brewery.name: Newgrass Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Lofty tasting room in a historic setting with Southern small plates, small-batch brews & live music.

brewery.name: Lenny Boy Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Lenny Boy was founded in 2011 with an interest in a healthy lifestyle, a passion for fermentation and an obsession with brewing. The company started off producing non-alcoholic kombucha with one 7 bbl fermenting tank. In 2012, we stumbled upon our current facility in the historic SouthEnd district in Charlotte, NC. In January of 2013 Lenny Boy became the only Certified Organic kombucha producer in the Southeast! In September 2013, we took it a step further and became a licensed microbrewery.  In doing so, we became the only certified organic brewery North Carolina! The new license allowed us to diversify our product line, which now includes kombucha, wild ales, and traditional beers. We currently produce 100 bbl of kombucha every month and have a 7 bbl traditional beer brewing system. Our kombucha can be found from Virginia to Alabama and our beers are currently within North Carolina.  ENJOY!

brewery.name: Kind Beer Distributing
brewery.description: The first offering from Kind Beers hit store shelves and restuarants in the Charlotte, North Carolina market in the summer of 2008. Since the introduction, our beers have made their way into establishments all over the Southeastern United States.

data.name: Main Brewery
data.hoursOfOperation:
Tuesdays and Thursdays 4 pm - 7 pm
Saturdays 2 pm - 8 pm

brewery.name: Lake Norman Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Lake Norman Brewing Company is a family owned and operated microbrewery located in Mooresville, NC. We specifically chose the name “Lake Norman” due to the Lake’s prominence and the vitality it represents to the population that thrives around it. Whether you love Lake Norman as your home or get-away, for the boating, the sunsets, the watersports, the swimming or the fishing, we are excited to be part of phenomenon known to the locals as
 the “Lake Life”.

data.name: Main Brewery
data.hoursOfOperation: Tours Monday thru Saturday typically at 11:00 am, 1:00 pm and 3:00 pm or by special appointments

brewery.name: Old North State Winery & Brewery
brewery.description: Old North State is the only winery in the state of North Carolina that is a licensed brewery. Our American Style Pale Ale uses Hops grown in Oregon with only natural products and whole grains in our production. Our hand crafted Ales are made in small batches and are available on tap at our tasting bar.

brewery.name: Neuse River Brewing Company
brewery.description:
At Neuse River Brewing Co. we concentrate on Belgian style ales and IPAs. Our goal is to pay homage to the traditional styles of beer which have been perfected throughout time although we are also passionate about experimenting with contemporary concepts and bridging the gaps between the two. Neuse River Brewing Co. incorporates sustainable practices and buys local whenever possible in an effort to support our neighbors.

NRBC will be located just outside the Five Points area in Raleigh, North Carolina. The 68 year old building, originally built for restoring and building firetrucks, will house the 20bbl brewhouse and tasting room. Come early 2015, patrons will be able to enjoy one of our Belgian inspired ales while taking in a view of the downtown Raleigh city skyline or relaxing beside the herb garden.

NRBC provides a gathering place for friends, family and community to share stories and quality time with one another. And, if we’re lucky, our beers will help to inspire new stories and memories for many years to come.
 
Santé!
